etymologies: early 20th century: from Latin vita ‘life’+ amine, because vitamins were originally thought to contain an amino acid

definitions: any of a group of organic compounds which are essential for normal growth and nutrition and are required in small quantities in the diet because they cannot be synthesized by the body

examples.text: most people can get all the vitamins they need from a healthy diet

shortDefinitions: any of group of organic compounds which are essential for normal growth and nutrition

definitions: a pill containing a specified amount of a particular vitamin or vitamins, taken as a dietary supplement

examples.text: I woke up this morning and took a vitamin

shortDefinitions: pill containing specified amount of vitamin
